section_title: Arthroscopic or Open Procedure for Fracture, Tumor, Infection, or Foreign Body (Evidence: pg no: 4, L149)
names: Shoulder Surgery for Fracture (Evidence: pg no: 4, L149)
Shoulder Surgery for Tumor (Evidence: pg no: 4, L149)
Shoulder Surgery for Infection (Evidence: pg no: 4, L149)
Shoulder Surgery for Foreign Body (Evidence: pg no: 4, L149)
description: Shoulder arthroscopic or open procedures for fracture, tumor, infection, or foreign body that has led to or will likely lead to progressive destruction (Evidence: pg no: 4, L149-L151)
scope: Arthroscopic or open procedures for specific pathological conditions (Evidence: pg no: 4, L149-L150)

documentation: Surgery being performed for fracture, tumor, infection, or foreign body that has led to or will likely lead to progressive destruction (Evidence: pg no: 4, L150-L151)

codes.description: Excision or curettage of bone cyst or benign tumor of clavicle or scapula; with autograft (includes obtaining graft) (Evidence: pg no: 13, L529-L530)
Excision or curettage of bone cyst or benign tumor of proximal humerus; with autograft (includes obtaining graft) (Evidence: pg no: 13, L531-L532)
Sequestrectomy (e.g. for osteomyelitis or bone abscess), scapula (Evidence: pg no: 13, L533)
Sequestrectomy (e.g. for osteomyelitis or bone abscess), humeral head to surgical neck (Evidence: pg no: 13, L534)

notes: May be considered medically necessary when surgery addresses progressive destruction (Evidence: pg no: 4, L149-L151)
